title: So bout that HORN-OVER

embed.description: This is the voice for the new Skin, Bard Sponsor: Lower your ping with WTFast, FREE TRIAL AVAILABLE! http://bit.ly/WTFastSpotlights Note: The Voice might not be final, you never know what tweaks Riot might make to it.

body: Yup, you heard it, bard is another champion that doesn't speak, he blows dat horn

replies.body:
This could have just been his special effects but instead we lose the voice-over a part that has been crucial to understanding champions because of the lack of lore. If we just get the standard 3 sentences for Bard, then he will have no character and just serves as a mechanics object instead of an actual person. 

In my opinion the Voice/horn over is a failure because unlike other champions or even Rek'sai this leaves us with barely any insight into the character. We already have lots of champions whose mysteriousness serves as one of their main themes (Jax, Aatrox, Amumu, etc.)
Eh, I think the bigger problem is the lack of interaction between champs nowadays and the stagnancy of the narrative.
Wow, third thing in a row WITHOUT a real voice over, Rek'Sai, DJ Sona and Bard. Riot is getting reeeaaallly lazy lately. I seriously don't get it.

DJ sona actually does have a voice it is just jumbled a bit though so that the lines fit perfectly into a song.

Rek'sai is meant to fully fulfill the primal beast theme so it makes since that she is voiceless (though why other Void creatures talk and she doesn't is a mystery). The various growls and sounds are each very different though so you can get some since of emotion from her.

Bard is what feels lazy to me. His VO is basically just his sound effects. Now because of the lack of lore the VO has been a necessary tool to get a hold of a champions personality but because of how Bard's VO is, that becomes impossible. We will probably only get a 3 sentence bio and without a VO Bard is basically limited to a game-play component who has no actual character.
Yeah. DJ Sona is just a remix of her audio, so she speaks... just it's all mixed up, and they didn't give her a new voice over like they did for the other ult skins but it still works.

Sorry, I think she says "metronome" somewhere in there. Riot said it was supposed to be based on Draft Punk, but you can understand them, unlike the new Sona skin.  I figure its just easier to use your already on staff sound guy over a professional voice actor.

You can hear her say Metronome as like I said it's just a remix of her audio but all of it isn't 100% clear. However Riot did say it was actually done the way it was so that you could focus more on the music rather then her talking.  This is also why when using the skin, a script is running that makes her "audio" not play as often.

That's fine. THey can have their reasons, just like I'm sure they have their reasons for Bard just being a horn (so we can focus on his Meep gathering).  But to be it just boils down to them being lazy.  THey were perfectly capable of adding a synthesized voice to Sona that fit her music and didn't play as much so the player could "focus on the music", but they took the easy route and just sound edited already existing audio files.

Honestly it just feels like a cop out to me. Seriously, of the last three "voiceovers" Riot has put our they've all been unintelligible. That's pretty bad. By my standards I don't count DJ Sons. Its her *old* lines jumbled up the player can't understand them. And I'm not even counting Gnar in those three. 

It's just plain laziness, there's nothing else to it. There's plenty of ways to fulfill those fantasies *with* intelligible voiceovers. But apparently they're going the way of champion dance emotes: minimal and lazy.

Original plan was to space Rek'Sai and Bard out a bit so they weren't back to back, in part because of the lack of voice lines, these release times ended up being better for other reasons though."

-cough-

Also, doing the audio like Bard's is *harder* to do than just recording dialogue from a sound perspective. You have to create it all, as opposed to adding layered effects on a person's voice.

> [{quoted}](name=Baron Von Bangin,realm=NA,application-id=aAJWt2b9,discussion-id=F1ZXb6oj,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-25T06:42:29.560+0000)
>
> Sorry, I think she says "metronome" somewhere in there. Riot said it was supposed to be based on Draft Punk, but you can understand them, unlike the new Sona skin.  I figure its just easier to use your already on staff sound guy over a professional voice actor.

You can understand French? Because none of the singing in Daft Punk's music is Thomas Bangalter or Guy-Manuel de Homem-Christo. It's either other musicians, or vocoders. That and maybe Sona's voice actress was unavailable to do recording for the new skin?

Fine. Meddler can say that Bard is the last champ for a "little" while that doesn't actually have a voice over.  That doesn't invalidate the fact that Riots past three major releases all lack a real, spoken voice over.  

You might wanna cover your mouth when you type the "cough" in.  Don't wanna spread your germs.

And doing Bard's voice isn't any harder. In fact it's easier.  Riot has a sound guy/staff on salary already on working (I guarantee you Riot pays salary based on the hours a game company will have you working).  He's getting paid the same amount no matter what.  If Riot has to bring in Erik Braa to do Vek'koz's voice or whatever, they have to pay the actor PLUS the guy editing the voice.  But by having Bard just be a horn you only pay the sound staff to blow a horn and edit it, that way you get to cut out having to pay those pesky actors. 

And no. I don't understand French and I fail to see how that's relevant. Last time I checked Get Lucky, One More Time, "Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger", Da Funk, Lose Yourself to Dance, Robot Rock, and Around the World (to name some of Daft Punks' more popular songs) all have *understandable* lyrics that go with their song, it doesn't matter if it's Thomas Bangalter or Guy-Manuel de Homem-Christo, there's stil la  voice in their song that *you can understand and it not gibberish*.  I would have been fine with almost anything for DJ Sona's voice over, provided it was *an actual voice over* and not just a bunch of noise.
Personally, I'm waiting for a skin that features him playing a Tsungi Horn.  Very calming and whimsical, his current one is.

Bard is clearly a Tripod from War of the Worlds (those opening noises)

Also, look up Princess Mononoke.... or any Studio Ghibli film. Bard seems to be heavily inspired by them and the mystical beings in them rarely "talk" in a traditional sense.

My issue with it is that he only has three and a half minutes of audio, whereas Rek'sai has 7.
